procedures module

procedures.callback(study, trial)[source]
procedures.create_study(trial_objective: str)[source]

Create an optuna study with the right direction of optimization for the desired objective function (either the loss, the error or the accuracy).

Parameters:

  • trial_objective (str) – A string containing the name of the desired objective function (either the loss, the

  • accuracy). (error or the) –

Returns:

Optuna study

procedures.get_trial_params(trial: Trial, model_name: str, nb_hidden_layers=1) → tuple[dict, dict][source]

Create two dictionaries containing the right hyperparameters for a given model.

Parameters:

  • trial (object) – A Trial instance representing a process of evaluating an objective function

  • model_name (str) – A string containing the name of the input model

  • nb_hidden_layers (int) – The number of hidden layers corresponds to the number of hyperparameters per category.

Returns:

Two dictionaries that contains the hyperparameters associated to the input model.

procedures.model_selection(config, save_dir='..\\results', device=device(type='cpu'), with_nonidealities=False, verbose=False)[source]
procedures.model_selection_objective(trial, model, model_trainer, selection_params, data_loaders_params, train_test_datasets, trial_objective, device, torch_seed, verbose)[source]
procedures.model_testing(config, model, device=device(type='cpu'), save_dir='./results/evaluation', verbose=False)[source]
procedures.model_train_eval(config, save_dir='..\\results', device=device(type='cpu'), with_nonidealities=False, verbose=False)[source]
procedures.train_eval_loop(model, train_loader, valid_loader, criterion, optimizer, device=None, nb_epochs=1, verbose=False, trial=None, trial_iter_nb=None, trial_objective='accuracy', model_trainer=None)[source]

Training procedure for the neural networks.

procedures.model

Pytorch model of nn.Module objects such as fully connected layers

Type:

nn.Module

procedures.train_loader

Pytorch DataLoader object associated to the training set.

procedures.valid_loader

Pytorch DataLoader object associated to the validation set.

procedures.criterion

Pytorch criterion (loss function).

procedures.optimizer

Pytorch optimizer such as SGD and Adam.

procedures.device

Pytorch torch.device object.

procedures.nb_epochs

Number of time the whole input dataloaders are used during the training session.

Type:

int

procedures.trial

Optuna trial object.

procedures.trial_iter_nb

The index associated to the number of time the training procedure is done.

Type:

int

procedures.verbose

If true, print extra information about the training procedure such as the loss and the accuracy.

Type:

bool

procedures.trial_objective

The desired objective function for the optimization procedure.

Returns:

A tuple containing two dictionaries, each one containing the metrics associated to the training and the validation procedure respectively.
